page.title: 06 The Mill at Coleford
page.content: On Wednesday 22nd May we visited the old {Coleford Mill. }The mill was built in 1794. When we went inside we saw all the bottles which were found in the {mill race.}There were forty two bottles and almost a complete clay pot. A lady showed us the {bread oven which was one and a half metres wide and two metres long. They used to use hazel twigs to warm up the oven. They lit the twigs and when the twigs had been burnt they put the bread in. We saw an old fireplace where people used to hang meat to keep it fresh. We saw some hand made nails which were very old. The whole Mill took up three floors. We saw the other side of the wheel. We found out it was an{undershot mill. We went outside and saw the hatches. When they were wound down the water would build up and start the wheel.
